page.title: 2008â09 Boston College Eagles men's ice hockey season

revisions.rev:
{{NCAAIceHockeyTeamSeason |Image = |ImageSize = |Season = 2008â09 |Team = Boston College Eagles |Sex = men |Conference = Hockey East Association |ShortConference = Hockey East |ConferenceRank = 6th |Poll#1 = USA Today/USA Hockey Magazine |Poll#1Rank = unranked |Poll#2 = USCHO.com/CBS College Sports |Poll#2Rank = #20 |Record = 18-14-5 |HomeRecord = 12-5-0 |RoadRecord = 5-7-5 |NeutralRecord = 1-2-0 |HeadCoach = [[Jerry York]] |AsstCoach1= Mike Cavanaugh |AsstCoach2= Greg Brown |AsstCoach3= Jim Logue |Captain = [[Brock Bradford]] |AltCaptain = [[Benn Ferriero]], Tim Filangieri |Arena = [[Conte Forum|Kelley Rink]] |Champion = |NCAATourney = |NCAATourneyResult = |prevseason = [[2007â08 Boston College Eagles men's ice hockey season|2007-08]] |nextseason = [[2009â10 Boston College Eagles men's ice hockey season|2009-10]] |headerstyle = background:#8B0000; color:#F0E68C; |labelstyle = background:#eeeeee; }} The '''2008-2009 Boston College Eagles men's ice hockey team''' represented [[Boston College]] in the 2008-2009 college hockey season. The team was coached by [[Jerry York]], '67, his fifteenth season behind the bench at Boston College. The Eagles played their home games at [[Conte Forum|Kelley Rink]] on the campus of Boston College, and competed in [[Hockey East]]. Boston College entered the season as defending National Champions after defeating [[Notre Dame Fighting Irish men's ice hockey|Notre Dame]] in the [[2008 NCAA Division I Men's Ice Hockey Tournament|2008 NCAA Tournament Championship]] game for the program's third National Championship. The Eagles raised their 2008 title banner to the rafters of Kelley Rink in their home opener against [[Wisconsin Badgers men's ice hockey|Wisconsin]] on October 10, 2008. The 2008-09 season was a generally poor one for the Eagles, as the team did not make the NCAA Tournament for the first time since 2002, and failed to defend both their [[Hockey East]] Tournament and [[Beanpot (ice hockey)|Beanpot]] titles from the previous year. Senior [[Brock Bradford]] captained the 2008-09 team after missing most of the 2007-08 season with an arm injury. ==Recruiting== Boston College added nine freshmen for the 2008-2009 season, including three defensemen, five forwards, and one goalie. {|class="wikitable" width="70%" |- align="center" style="background:#8B0000;color:#F0E68C;" | '''Player''' || '''Position''' || '''Nationality''' || '''Notes''' |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Tommy Cross || Defense || {{USA}} || [[Simsbury, CT]]; Selected 35th overall by [[Boston Bruins|BOS]] in [[2007 NHL Entry Draft|2007 draft]]. |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Edwin Shea || Defense || {{USA}} || [[Shrewsbury, MA]]; Three-time [[EJHL]] All-Star selection. |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Barry Almeida || Forward || {{USA}} || [[Springfield, MA]]; Earned All-[[USHL]] First Team Honors with [[Omaha Lancers|Omaha]]. |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Jimmy Hayes || Forward || {{USA}} || [[Dorchester, MA]]; Selected 60th overall by [[Toronto Maple Leafs|TOR]] in [[2008 NHL Entry Draft|2008 draft]]. |- align="center" bgcolor="" | [[Cam Atkinson]] || Forward || {{USA}} || [[Greenwich, CT]]; Selected 157th overall by [[Columbus Blue Jackets|CBJ]] in [[2008 NHL Entry Draft|2008 draft]]. |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Paul Carey || Forward || {{USA}} || [[Weymouth, MA]]; Selected 135th overall by [[Colorado Avalanche|COL]] in [[2007 NHL Entry Draft|2007 draft]]. |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Malcolm Lyles || Defense || {{USA}} || [[Miami Gardens, FL]]; Played three seasons at [[Deerfield Academy]] (MA). |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Tommy Atkinson || Forward || {{USA}} || [[Greenwich, CT]]; Helped lead [[Avon Old Farms]] to two New England Prep School titles. |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Chris Venti || Goalie|| {{USA}} || [[Needham, MA]];
